Welcome Reception

When: 17:00 – 19:00 on Tuesday, 7 November
Where: The Expo, Hall 7.0

Kick off your VMware Explore experience at the welcome reception in The Expo.
Get your first look at the show floor, network with fellow attendees in a fun atmosphere, pick up some new swag, and enjoy delicious appetizers and drinks.

Hall Crawl

When: 17:00 – 19:00 on Wednesday, 8 November
Where: The Expo, Hall 7.0

The hall crawl gives you the chance to get up close and personal with the VMware ecosystem, sponsors and exhibitors in The Expo.
Participate in giveaways, get in-depth product information, pick up some swag, and socialize while enjoying snacks and drinks at the sponsor stands.

Stop by Hall 8.0 to have a 1:1 discussion with a VMware product engineer at the expert bar and get all your questions answered.

Hands-on Labs

Dive headfirst into the world of cutting-edge VMware products and solutions. With our expert-led workshops, interactive labs, and production-quality VMware TestDrive demos, you'll get hands-on experience with the full VMware portfolio of products. Get full access to the subject matter experts who create the labs from scratch to ask questions or deep dive into VMware solutions.

It provides an ideal end-to-end, streamlined DevOps experience so teams can: Jumpstart application development. Developers get a sane starting place for their cloud native apps with application accelerators. These templates include skeleton code, configurations, and cloud native patterns combined with an organization’s best practices and security policies. Boost developer velocity.  Developers get a consistent graphical user interface (GUI) to underlining services and APIs, making them easy to discover and integrate with other apps. Developers can work right in their integrated development environment (IDE) with Tanzu Application Platform developer tools. They can debug a running container on any Kubernetes cluster (running locally or on a managed Kubernetes cluster) and quickly update code in a running container, enabling them to quickly test and iterate. Accelerate the path to production.

Accelerate the path to production. No more “wall of YAML” for deploying apps to Kubernetes. Operators can use the Supply Chain Choreographer to create preapproved paths to production and can customize it to bring their own opinions to meet business needs. In addition, the build service uses Cloud Native Buildpacks to automatically create containers from validated building blocks and update them with no manual intervention. All of this reduces friction for developers and enables a stronger security posture."}},{"@type":"Question","name":"What are the benefits of Tanzu Application Platform?","acceptedAnswer":{"@type":"Answer","text":"With Tanzu Application Platform, you can deliver revenue-generating applications to market more quickly because your developers can spend more time building great software instead of toiling and stitching components together. With Tanzu Application Platform, you can realize economies of scale from your multi-cloud Kubernetes platform. Delivering a prepaved path to production and a superior, end-to-end multi-cloud developer experience on Kubernetes Tanzu Application Platform lets you: Make your developers happy. Enable developers to quickly get started with preconfigured templates for cloud native patterns and instant access to dev tooling to rapidly iterate and debug code.Bring your own opinions. Automate the entire app deployment with a built-in secure software supply chain that’s composable and customizable, so app teams can bring their own opinions and swap components to meet their business needs. Embody DevOps for a smooth path to production. Establish a clear separation of concern between developers and operators for seamless handoff of application from development to production."}},{"@type":"Question","name":"Who uses Tanzu Application Platform?","acceptedAnswer":{"@type":"Answer","text":"Tanzu Application Platform provides development teams a prepaved path to production to get code running on Kubernetes in a multi-cloud environment enabling security and scale. It’s an application-aware platform that is modular so app teams can customize it based on their organization’s preferences. Developers: Starting with the templates, developers turn source code into a container and get a URL to test their app in minutes.

Once the container is built, updating it happens automatically every time there’s a new code commit or dependency patch. And connecting to other applications and data—regardless of how they’re built or what kind of infrastructure they run on—has never been easier thanks to an internal API management portal. Operators: Operators can configure the supply chain with baked-in security and compliance guardrails, making those considerations mostly invisible for developers to take the committed code to production. "}},{"@type":"Question","name":"What is Supply Chain Choreographer?","acceptedAnswer":{"@type":"Answer","text":"The Supply Chain Choreographer allows app operators to create preapproved paths to production, integrating Kubernetes resources and their existing toolchains (e.g., Jenkins). Tanzu Application Platform Key Capabilities

Enhance developer productivity and user experience

Unlock developer productivity with a Kubernetes abstraction layer enabling faster, more secure app design, development, and delivery.

Jumpstart app development. Use preconfigured cloud native pattern templates to bootstrap new applications.

Boost developer velocity. Get a consistent GUI to bring services and APIs together in one management portal.

Accelerate the path to production. Secure software supply chains automate out-of-the-box app deployment.

net/images/products/tap/Tanzu-Application-Platform-Accelerators.png'>
Watch Demo

cloudfront.net/images/products/tas/logo-microsoft-azure.svg'>

Runs on any compliant public cloud or on-premises Kubernetes cluster

Tanzu Application Platform supports a multi-cloud environment and runs on any API-conformant Kubernetes distribution.

Build with a modular, composable platform

Operations teams use Supply Chain Choreographer to create preapproved paths to production with security and compliance baked in to take the committed code to production. The platform is modular so teams can easily swap the supply chain components to meet business needs.

Platform-as-a-Service (PaaS) for Kubernetes

App modernization and legacy app migration

Evolve important business apps interacting with middleware stacks that are 10–15 years old. Eliminate inflexible app servers and stacks that don’t support automation. Better align crucial applications to rapidly changing requirements.

Frequently Asked Questions

What is VMware Tanzu Application Platform?

Tanzu Application Platform (TAP) is a modular, application-aware platform that runs on any compliant public cloud or on-premises Kubernetes cluster. It delivers a superior multi-cloud developer experience with a prepaved path to production including all the needed components preconfigured for developer teams to build and deploy software quickly and securely. It’s a composable platform that teams can customize based on their organization’s preferences and changing business needs.

What are the leading capabilities of Tanzu Application Platform?

Tanzu Application Platform works across any Kubernetes to simplify the developer and operator experience.

It provides an ideal end-to-end, streamlined DevOps experience so teams can:

  • Jumpstart application development. Developers get a sane starting place for their cloud native apps with application accelerators. These templates include skeleton code, configurations, and cloud native patterns combined with an organization’s best practices and security policies.
  • Boost developer velocity. Developers get a consistent graphical user interface (GUI) to underlining services and APIs, making them easy to discover and integrate with other apps. Developers can work right in their integrated development environment (IDE) with Tanzu Application Platform developer tools. They can debug a running container on any Kubernetes cluster (running locally or on a managed Kubernetes cluster) and quickly update code in a running container, enabling them to quickly test and iterate.
  • Accelerate the path to production. No more “wall of YAML” for deploying apps to Kubernetes. Operators can use the Supply Chain Choreographer to create preapproved paths to production and can customize it to bring their own opinions to meet business needs. In addition, the build service uses Cloud Native Buildpacks to automatically create containers from validated building blocks and update them with no manual intervention. All of this reduces friction for developers and enables a stronger security posture.

What are the benefits of Tanzu Application Platform?

With Tanzu Application Platform, you can deliver revenue-generating applications to market more quickly because your developers can spend more time building great software instead of toiling and stitching components together.

Your products will also be more secure, which not only saves you cost by avoiding downtime, but also avoids significant damage to your brand.

Realizing the value of Kubernetes can be an elusive endeavor. With Tanzu Application Platform, you can realize economies of scale from your multi-cloud Kubernetes platform. Delivering a prepaved path to production and a superior, end-to-end multi-cloud developer experience on Kubernetes Tanzu Application Platform lets you:

  • Make your developers happy. Enable developers to quickly get started with preconfigured templates for cloud native patterns and instant access to dev tooling to rapidly iterate and debug code.
  • Bring your own opinions. Automate the entire app deployment with a built-in secure software supply chain that’s composable and customizable, so app teams can bring their own opinions and swap components to meet their business needs.
  • Embody DevOps for a smooth path to production. Establish a clear separation of concern between developers and operators for seamless handoff of application from development to production.

Who uses Tanzu Application Platform?

Tanzu Application Platform provides development teams a prepaved path to production to get code running on Kubernetes in a multi-cloud environment enabling security and scale. It’s an application-aware platform that is modular so app teams can customize it based on their organization’s preferences.

Developers: Starting with the templates, developers turn source code into a container and get a URL to test their app in minutes. Once the container is built, updating it happens automatically every time there’s a new code commit or dependency patch.

And connecting to other applications and data—regardless of how they’re built or what kind of infrastructure they run on—has never been easier thanks to an internal API management portal.

Operators: Operators can configure the supply chain with baked-in security and compliance guardrails, making those considerations mostly invisible for developers to take the committed code to production. Operators can use the supply chain choreographer to create preapproved paths to production and can also customize it by swapping components in to bring their own expert opinions and to meet changing business needs.

What is Supply Chain Choreographer?

The Supply Chain Choreographer allows app operators to create preapproved paths to production, integrating Kubernetes resources and their existing toolchains (e.g., Jenkins). These preapproved supply chains create paved roads to production, orchestrating supply chain components (test, build, scan, and deploy) and allowing developers to focus on delivering value to their users while also providing app operators with the peace of mind that all code in production has passed through an approved workflow. Although strong defaults make it easier to get started, if one of VMware’s choices of components doesn’t work for you, app operators can swap out components based on their organization's requirements and preferences.

                                                    General

When and where will VMware Explore 2023 in Barcelona take place? 
VMware Explore will take place in Barcelona, Spain at the Fira Gran Via, 6 – 9 November 2023. 

What is the address of the Fira Gran Via?
Fira Gran Via
Carrer del Foc 10
08038 Barcelona

What is VMware Explore?
VMware Explore is VMware’s flagship event for all things multi-cloud. VMware Explore aims to facilitate new relationships, inspire learning, and provide hands-on training and access to thought leadership in the multi-cloud space. 

Who should attend VMware Explore?
Those engaged in enterprise applications, cloud architecture, infrastructure, end users, networking and security will be among their peers at VMware Explore as we’re inviting all to help build the new multi-cloud world.

What should I know before I arrive onsite?
View the Plan Your Experience page for important logistical information and for details on the VMware Explore mobile app.

Will there be an online offering?
Yes, there will be a live broadcast for the General Session on Tuesday, 7 November from 09:00 to 10:00 CET. This live broadcast is free to attend and will be streamed through the VMware Explore website. You can see more information and sign up for reminders on the Broadcast page.

What is the common language spoken at VMware Explore in Barcelona?
The official language of the event is English, and all general sessions, breakout sessions, and hands-on labs will be presented in English. If you wish to bring a translator, please contact the VMware Explore registration team at vmwareexploreeuregistration@vmware-events.com for more information.

What is the recommended event attire?
Casual to business dress is appropriate. We do recommend dressing in layers as temperatures can vary.

Is there an age minimum to attend?
You must be at least 18 years of age to attend VMware Explore in Barcelona.

What disability accommodations are available?
At VMware, we strive to create a welcoming and inclusive event experience for every attendee.

If you require an accommodation for a disability, please indicate your requirements on the registration form.

What sustainability efforts are made for VMware Explore?
At VMware Explore, we are furthering VMware’s journey to net zero by partnering with forward-thinking organizations that share our commitment to environmental sustainability. Learn more on the Sustainability page.

Who do I contact for questions?
Please visit our contact page for more information.
Registration

What are the registration fees for the event?
View the registration pricing page to see the current rate of the full event pass and what is included. Pass prices listed do not include taxes. Registration fees may be subject to Spanish tax at 10%. Click here for a copy of the VAT registration certificate.

Are there any discounts?
Yes, we offer discounts for early registration, groups and VMUG Advantage level members. View the registration pricing page for more information.

What payments do you accept for registration?
When registering, you can pay by credit card. Payment must be received to print a badge onsite. 

Is there a deadline for registration?
No, there's no deadline. You can register online through the last day of the event. 

Can I be denied registration for any reason?
VMware reserves the right to deny registration to any individual or entity for any reason, at VMware's sole discretion, including past or present failure to meet VMware's standards of conduct, and also including (but not limited to) engaging in violent, illegal, threatening, or discriminatory conduct.

illegal, threatening, or discriminatory conduct.

Can I register for multiple VMware Explore events?
Registration for each event is separate, and you will need to register and pay (if applicable) for each event independently.
Event Access
Will I need a badge to get in?

Will I need a badge to get in?
Yes, an event badge is required for entry and should be worn at all times. You'll be able to pick up your badge at a VMware Explore registration check-in desk during open registration hours. For security purposes, be prepared to show identification. If you lose your badge, you can show photo identification and have it reprinted at the registration assistance desk for a fee.

Do I need a visa to attend the conference?
There are a few countries that require a visa for entry. We recommend checking in advance with your country's local Spanish consulate for details and requirements. 

How do I obtain a visa invitation letter?
During the registration process, you will be asked if you require a visa letter. In order to request a visa letter from the VMware Explore team, please be prepared to provide the following information:

  • Full name on passport
  • Date and place of birth
  • Gender
  • Nationality
  • Passport number, place and date of issue, and date of expiration
  • Are you a government official? [yes, no]

Visa invitation letters will be submitted for approval for attendees who have requested a letter and have completed registration data for a full conference pass, including payment. Please note that we can only issue visa letters for fully paid attendees and you will need to allow two to three weeks for your embassy to process your request. Visa letter requests will not be accepted after 13 October.
Housing and Transportation

What event shuttles are provided for VMware Explore Barcelona?
Visit the Plan Your Experience page for full information. VMware Explore will provide airport shuttle service on select days and shuttles to central Barcelona after The Party on Wednesday evening.

There are no shuttles between the hotels and the Fira Gran Via. To get to the venue you can take the Metro to either Fira (L9) station (8-minute walk) or Foc (L10) station (6-minute walk).

Metro cards will be available at the Info Desk as first come, first serve.

Which hotels are official VMware Explore Barcelona hotels?
Limited Availability: The VMware Explore hotel block is nearly sold out. If rooms are not available for your desired dates, please contact the hotel directly or use a third-party booking platform.

View the list of hotels to choose from while attending VMware Explore Barcelona. These hotels have been chosen with convenience and budgetary requirements in mind to best fit your needs. To secure a room at the event rate, make your hotel arrangements via the VMware Explore booking tool after you complete registration. You are also free to make your own reservations directly with the hotel of your choice if you would like to book outside of the VMware Explore hotel block.

Do I need to contact the hotel to book my reservation in the VMware Explore room block?
When you register online for VMware Explore, you will have an opportunity to request your hotel room in the event room block and provide your check-in and check-out dates. A hotel reservation will be made for you and guaranteed with your credit card. If rooms are not available for your desired dates, please contact the hotel directly or use a third-party booking platform.

If I am not registered for VMware Explore; how do I book my hotel room?
You are free to make your own reservations directly with the hotel of your choice. However, to take advantage of the VMware Explore discounted room rates, you must be registered for VMware Explore and make your hotel arrangements via the VMware Explore booking process.

Do I need to give a credit card to reserve my room?
Yes, a credit card will be needed to confirm your reservation at a designated VMware Explore hotel.
Meals

aria-hidden="true">

What special dietary requirements are accommodated for event-provided meals?
If you have any special dietary requests, please be sure to inform us during the registration process. Limited vegetarian and gluten-free options are available at most event-related meal functions.

Limited vegetarian and gluten-free options are available at most event-related meal functions.

What meals are provided?
The following attendee meals and refreshments are included with your purchase of a full event pass:

  • Monday: light refreshments (cash concessions will be available on-site)
  • Tuesday: lunch and light appetizers at welcome reception 
  • Wednesday: lunch, refreshments at the hall crawl and food stations at the party
  • Thursday: lunch

line-accordLine_white line-accord">
Sessions and Speakers

What is the content catalog?
Begin marking your favorite sessions and building your schedule in the VMware Explore 2023 Barcelona Content Catalog today. The content catalog provides a comprehensive list of breakout sessions, hands-on labs, and other sessions. Whether you've already registered or are still considering attending VMware Explore, you can use the content catalog to check out topics and speakers, and find the sessions that meet your event goals.

Can I preregister for sessions?
Yes! If you have completed your registration and payment for VMware Explore, you can preregister for sessions and begin building out your personal schedule for the week. Because breakout sessions can fill up quickly, we advise preregistering at your earliest convenience.

Can I get copies of the material presented at the event?
Yes, most presentations will be posted after VMware Explore. Please note that only those sessions that are pre-approved for publication are made available online.

What sessions will be broadcast live?
There will be a live broadcast for the General Session on Tuesday, 7 November from 09:00 to 10:00 CET. This live broadcast is free to attend and will be streamed through the VMware Explore website. You can see more information and sign up for reminders on the Broadcast page.

How can I access content from past events?

Visit the VMware Explore Video Library for on-demand content from VMware Explore events. VMware Explore 2023 Barcelona on-demand content will be added to the library by Friday, 10 November. You can view VMworld 2021 sessions in the VMworld Video Archive. Access is free of charge but requires a VMware ID to view.

I would like to learn more about 2023 sponsorship opportunities. Who can I contact? 

Please complete this form to contact the sponsorship team.

Badge Pickup and Registration

Pick up your badge in the Hall 8.0 foyer.

To speed up the process, get your Print Badge QR Code from the mobile app and have your photo ID ready.

Don’t forget to add your badge photo in the My Event Portal.

Late to the party?

Don’t worry—onsite registration is available for €1,775.

 

Visit the Agenda page to see
registration hours for each day >

Coat and Bag Drop

Coat and bag drop will be available in the Hall 8.0 foyer where you can store any items you don’t wish to carry with you at the event or to The Party.

Sustainability at VMware Explore

At VMware Explore, we are furthering VMware’s journey to net zero by partnering with forward-thinking organizations that share our commitment to environmental sustainability. Together, we organized initiatives throughout your event experience aimed at mitigating carbon emissions, diverting waste from landfills, and promoting sustainable practices.

Arrival Transfer Shuttles from Airport to Fira Gran Via

Sunday, 5 November: 15:00 - 18:00

Monday, 6 November: 10:00 - 18:00

 

  • Approximately every 30 minutes
  • Pick-up from Terminal 1 and Terminal 2
  • Meet at arrivals after customs.

Look for staff with event branded signs/paddles who will direct attendees to the shuttles
  • Please note there is not a VMware Explore support/help desk at the airport
  • Drop off at event venue, Fira Gran Via, outside the Hall 8.0 entrance on Carrer de l’Alumini
  • Register and collect your VMware Explore badge, then proceed to hotel on own

The Party Shuttles from Fira Gran Via to Central Barcelona

Wednesday, 8 November: 19:30 - 21:45

 

  • Approximately every 30 minutes
  • Shuttles available to take you back to central Barcelona after The Party
  • Departs from the Fira Gran Via outside Hall 8.0 on Carrer de l’Alumini
  • Drop-off at two central locations
    • Plaça d’Espanya
      Nearby metro station: Espanya
    • Barceloneta (Passeig de Colom,

1)
Nearby metro stations: Jaume 1 and Barceloneta

Departure Transfer Shuttles from Fira Gran Via to Airport

Thursday, 9 November: 11:00 - 15:30

 

  • Approximately every 30 minutes
  • Departs from the Fira Gran Via outside Hall 8.0 on Carrer de l’Alumini
  • Drop-off at Terminal 1 and Terminal 2

Official Hotels

Below, you’ll find a list of hotels to choose from while attending VMware Explore Barcelona. These hotels have been chosen with convenience and budgetary requirements in mind to best fit your needs. To secure a room at the event rate, make your hotel arrangements via the VMware Explore booking tool after you complete registration. You are also free to make your own reservations directly with the hotel of your choice if you would like to book outside of the VMware Explore hotel block.

 

Limited Availability: The VMware Explore hotel block is nearly sold out. If rooms are not available for your desired dates, please contact the hotel directly or use a third-party booking platform.

Welcome Reception

When: 17:00 – 19:00 on Tuesday, 7 November
Where: The Expo, Hall 7.0

Kick off your VMware Explore experience at the welcome reception in The Expo.
Get your first look at the show floor, network with fellow attendees in a fun atmosphere, pick up some new swag, and enjoy delicious appetizers and drinks.

Hall Crawl

When: 17:00 – 19:00 on Wednesday, 8 November
Where: The Expo, Hall 7.0

The hall crawl gives you the chance to get up close and personal with the VMware ecosystem, sponsors and exhibitors in The Expo.
Participate in giveaways, get in-depth product information, pick up some swag, and socialize while enjoying snacks and drinks at the sponsor stands.

Cancellation Policy

All cancellations must be received in writing via email at VMwareExploreEURegistration@vmware-events.com. If you cancel prior to 17:00 CEST on 10 October 2023, you will receive a full refund. After 10 October at 17:00 CEST, please email the registration team to learn about your cancellation options.
Group pass purchases are non-refundable.

Hotel Reservations

Limited Availability: The VMware Explore hotel block is nearly sold out. If rooms are not available for your desired dates, please contact the hotel directly or use a third-party booking platform.

 

View the list of hotels to choose from while attending VMware Explore Barcelona. These hotels have been chosen with convenience and budgetary requirements in mind to best fit your needs. To secure a room at the event rate, make your hotel arrangements via the VMware Explore booking tool after you complete registration.
You are also free to make your own reservations directly with the hotel of your choice if you would like to book outside of the VMware Explore hotel block.
